column4: oh my god, finally....... so i just copied the new libffd file with the old name, and changed the permissions of usr/lib so I can do that.... now this stinking thing works :)
OUCH.
whats the output of lsb_release -sc ?
Whats this libbfd thing? From where did you install it?
Well, then I cant help you much, sorry.
ln -s oldfile newname
? I think I tried it.
You did: ln -s newname oldfile

so, basically, (1) my error when compiling is "fbc: error loading shared libraries: libbfd-2.21.53-system.20110810.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory", and I think the new file is called libbfd-2.22-system.so.. any idea on how to fix this?
You dont have to touch the permissions of /usr/lib at all.
Just use sudo cp next time.
Did you change the permissions back to what they've been before?
what are they now, on your box?
Which command did you run, exactly?
Well, and using which command?
So you used sudo chmod but you did not use sudo cp? Odd.
NO. DONT touch the permissions.
Use sudo.
By not linking statically.
Then you have to live with that warning.
